alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 03 at 12:42PM PST until March 06 at 2:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT TO 2 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches above 5000 feet, and 1 to 3 inches between 4000 and 5000 feet are expected. * WHERE...Above 4000 feet. * WHEN...Midnight Friday night to 2 AM Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibility at times in snow, blowing snow and fog. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
